channel.title: Enforcing moparisthebest TOS on my website
channel.description:
I'm currently using you're, moparisthebest, ToS (http://www.moparisthebest.com/agreement.phps) and I am still having problems with DMCA emails. For example here is one legit or not IDC, I want to enforce the agreement since he is a jagex member infringing the TOS and on my site:
[code]Subject: RE: Notification of Copyright Infringement - ds-forums.com [ IP : 78.159.102.151 ] Date: Tue, 23 Nov 2010 11:41:36 +0000 From: copyright@jagex.com To: "abuse@netdirekt.de"
Dear Sirs,
Thank you for your prompt reply.
Indeed, links reported in the initial notification that was sent on the 22nd November have been removed. However, as per our notification sent today, the infringing materials still exist and are now being distributed on the website under a different URL (http://ds-forums.com/index.php?pageid=play).
Therefore, we believe that the issue has not been resolved, as the infringing materials have been relocated to a different section of the ds-forums.com website instead of being removed as requested.
Accordingly, I would be grateful if you could look into removing the infringing materials reported or disabling access to the ds-forums.com website as a whole.
Thank you for your time and I look forward to your response.
Sincerely,
Bogdans Stakins Liaison, Copyright & Intellectual Property copyright@jagex.com www.jagex.com | www.runescape.com [/code]
How am I supposed to use the TOS to the fullest if this guy keeps doing this yenno?

item.title: Enforcing moparisthebest TOS on my website
item.dc:creator: @Innovation Innovation
item.description:
@Innovation wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:18, topic:375650”]for fucks sake dont block the whole of the uk

a tos is pretty useless too

[size=4pt]terms of service: by reading any word or letter in this post you hereby agree to punch yourself in the face[/size][/quote]

Haha Nice. And no I’m not blocking all of UK. I’ve already blocked subnets of Jagex.com and Runescape.com in my iptables /16 so it should be good there. But I’m also blocking the members on my forum that have zero post count and from the UK & USA. Since if they never post then something must be up. Of course I won’t get rid of them if they recently joined… But a few months must mean they are either stalking the board and most likely are behind the acts of jagex spoofing. I find it hard to believe jagex would be after my board and not some other board who is more popular yenno? We’re already sort of a dying community. So I know whoever is spoofing jagex isn’t a legit jagex member, and is probably someone probably not even in the UK. So I will have to block all those users from any country I guess… Zero post count won’t be missed on my board so it’s not a big deal.

Still I think real matters should be after other sites like SG or RL. Those other servers on toplists… Pretty pathetic their after my board lol. I guess no one can get enough eh? xD

Read full topic
item.source: Enforcing moparisthebest TOS on my website

item.title: Enforcing moparisthebest TOS on my website
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Innovation, post:16, topic:375650”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=471583.msg3449493#msg3449493 date=1293647852]
I ‘enforce’ it when they email me saying I am breaking their TOS, I email them back saying they are breaking my TOS. I don’t think either one is enforceable in court, so it’s kind of a stalemate.

If you are actively infringing on actual copyright laws, that is illegal and a different story, and I severely doubt your TOS will do anything to help you.
[/quote]

I guess I am infringing since the client is copyrighted.[/quote]don’t worry, so is moparisthebest

Read full topic

[quote=“Greeny, post:12, topic:375650”]Well Sythe’s been doing it for like 5-6 years and I’ve never bothered to proxy. Copyright lawyers aren’t likely to know how to proxy either.

Blocking the whole UK is a drastic action though, not that I care to visit your site - so go ahead.[/quote]
Sythe blocks all of UK?

item.title: Enforcing moparisthebest TOS on my website
item.dc:creator: @Innovation Innovation
item.description:
@Innovation wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:10, topic:375650”]http://www.irnis.net/soft/xipl/

edit:
Just had a thought, what you could also do is grab their IP address and then do a whois and check the country code, if its in the UK then die(); this would have to be in your index file and have to pass to be able to visit any of your website, similar to how mitb does his TOS.[/quote]

Good idea. I’ll start logging IP’s now and do a mass lookup. Then block the ones who are most likely wrongful UK people! They will die();

Thanks Ollie.

Read full topic

You do know that your tos doesn’t mean anything right?
[/quote]

How does it mean nothing? Doesn’t it work for moparscape and moparisthebest? I modified it to fit my sites specifications but still why does it mean nothing?

Also, I would block all UK users but I can’t do that. Maybe I can just block Jagex and other stuff in my ip tables.[/quote]geocentric ip restrictions

item.title: Enforcing moparisthebest TOS on my website
item.dc:creator: @Innovation Innovation
item.description:
@Innovation wrote:

I’m currently using you’re, moparisthebest, ToS (http://www.moparisthebest.com/agreement.phps) and I am still having problems with DMCA emails. For example here is one legit or not IDC, I want to enforce the agreement since he is a jagex member infringing the TOS and on my site:

[code]Subject:
RE: Notification of Copyright Infringement - ds-forums.com [ IP : 78.159.102.151 ]
Date:
Tue, 23 Nov 2010 11:41:36 +0000
From:
copyright@jagex.com
To:
"abuse@netdirekt.de"

Dear Sirs,

Thank you for your prompt reply.

Indeed, links reported in the initial notification that was sent on the 22nd November have been removed.
However, as per our notification sent today, the infringing materials still exist and are now being distributed on the website under a different URL (http://ds-forums.com/index.php?pageid=play).

Therefore, we believe that the issue has not been resolved, as the infringing materials have been relocated to a different section of the ds-forums.com website instead of being removed as requested.

Accordingly, I would be grateful if you could look into removing the infringing materials reported or disabling access to the ds-forums.com website as a whole.

Thank you for your time and I look forward to your response.

Sincerely,

Bogdans Stakins
Liaison, Copyright & Intellectual Property
copyright@jagex.com
www.jagex.com | www.runescape.com
[/code]

How am I supposed to use the TOS to the fullest if this guy keeps doing this yenno?
